attributes.action: Allow the NHS to make charges to patients  receiving emergency treatment for self inflicted injuries.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whilst it is generally accepted that treatment on the NHS is free at the point of issue, there should be no reason why some charging for treatment could be made for injuries caused by, say, alcohol abuse.

If an ambulance is called to a road traffic accident, a charge is subsequently made for its use. 

The revenue collected could then be used to improve the conditions of the various A & E centres.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
